The arrow shape is determined by
Each arrow is internally represented by a filled polygon with a default edge linewidth of 0. As a result, an arrow is rather a filled area, not a line with a head, and
The arrow is drawn as a polygon using the nodes as shown below. The values
The defaults give a slightly swept-back arrow. Here are some guidelines how to get other head shapes:
To make the head a triangle, make
To make the arrow more pointed, reduce
To make the head smaller relative to the shaft, scale down all the head   parameters proportionally.
To remove the head completely, set all
To get a diamond-shaped head, make
), the "headaxis"   nodes (i.e. the ones connecting the head with the shaft) will protrude out   of the head in forward direction so that the arrow head looks broken.

Method for determining the angle of the arrows.
'uv': Arrow direction in screen coordinates. Use this if the arrows   symbolize a quantity that is not based on
the orientation of the arrow on the plot is 45 degrees   counter-clockwise from the  horizontal axis (positive to the right).
'xy': Arrow direction in data coordinates, i.e. the arrows point from   (x, y) to (x+u, y+v). Use this e.g. for plotting a gradient field.
Arbitrary angles may be specified explicitly as an array of values   in degrees, counter-clockwise from the horizontal axis.
is only used to determine the length of the   arrows.
Note: inverting a data axis will correspondingly invert the arrows only with
The part of the arrow that is anchored to the
grid. The arrow rotates about this point.
Scales the length of the arrow inversely.

'width', 'height': The width or height of the Axes.
'dots', 'inches': Pixels or inches based on the figure dpi.
